name: PARNASO #6 - Bride's veil
description:
I don't know about you, but I have a slight feeling that all waterfalls are called Bride's veil... This one marks the end of our journey up. What a milestone! We managed to get there! Captured while my wife was sleeping on a very comfy rock below a nice shade and a fresh breeze. Now it's time to head back home - another mile but this time downwards. In Portuguese we have a saying that's something like "Downwards every saint helps". I don't think so... (SPOILER: It wasn't!).

About the series: Pictures taken in and around the Serra dos Órgãos National Park ('Parque Nacional da Serra dos Órgãos' in portuguese or its abbreviation 'PARNASO'), located in the state of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, and covers a huge area across four municipalities.

Equipment: Sony Alpha A6500 + Sony E 18-135mm F/3.5-5.6 OSS
Location: Petrópolis, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.
